page.title: 06STILE HOUSE CROSS
page.content: Stile House is the name given to a farm in the north-west sector of the Bradnop study area. Half a mile from the farm in an easterly direction lies one of the biggest mysteries associated with Bradnop. In a field one can find a monument - "Stile House Cross". It is about 9 feet high although it has lost its top stone. The monument has a hexagonal shaft which is mounted on a three step plinth. The top step is hexagonal whilst THE other two are rounded. Nobody is sure why the shrine was placed in such an isolated spot or why it was built. Local rumour suggests it was either a meeting place for the parish or built to ward off the plague.
